title: Be Concerned About Tesla's Q3 Earnings Miss?
text: Despite missing earnings expectations yesterday evening, Tesla (TSLA) stock was resilient in Thursday's trading session.

title: 7 Stocks Taking The Next Step To Be On Offense
text: Bio-Rad Laboratories was a positive contributor after the company reported steadier earnings than the market expected. PVH also remains our largest share repurchaser for the year after buying a teens percentage of shares outstanding at great prices. Rayonier was an immediate contributor.

title: Former Tesla bull slams Elon Musk and company, Intel earnings show signs of hope for turnaround plan
text: Former Tesla bull Ross Gerber, CEO of Ross Kawasaki, weighs in on the company's third quarter earnings. Gerber criticizes CEO Elon Musk, calling him the 'most hated man in the world,' and calls FSD a complete disappointment.

title: Elon Musk's $1T pay package is 'most absurd pay package in the history of business' investor says
text: Tesla (TSLA) shareholders will vote on CEO Elon Musk's pay package, which could be valued at up to $1 trillion, at the EV maker's annual meeting on November 6. This pay package stipulates very specific operational goals Musk must meet, including reaching a market cap of $8.5 trillion over the next decade.

title: 'Teardown Titan' Discusses Tesla's Cheaper Product Lines
text: Investors are expressing skepticism about Tesla's new cheaper Model 3 sedan and Model Y SUV. Sandy Munro, ex-CEO of Munro and Associates - known for tearing apart cars and telling automakers how well or poorly the vehicles are built - discusses Tesla's lower-cost models and what products he'd like to see the EV maker release.

title: Musk's Pay Package Pulls Focus From Tesla Earnings
text: Elon Musk's proposed $1 trillion pay package dominated the company's earnings call. TD Cowen autos equity research analyst Itay Michaeli discusses why competition plans line up with TD Cowen's thesis on the company's future.

title: Johnson: Tech CapEx Powers Market, TSLA Speculative Play, GOOGL & META's Ad Wildcard
text: Cory Johnson's big picture on tech is that it continues to drive markets and the economy, primarily due to capex spending on A.I. On the earnings picture, he liked IBM Corp.'s (IBM) "pretty good" quarter but didn't lean on Tesla's (TSLA) record revenue, believing the company relies too much on future prospects.

title: Tesla's Stock Wavers After Earnings. Next Up: A Big Vote on Elon Musk's Pay
text: Tesla's monthslong upward run has slowed. That has investors contemplating what's next for the stock with a vote on a huge new pay package for its chief just around the corner.

title: Tesla Still Has Mileage Despite Recent Headwinds
text: Tesla, Inc. remains a Buy despite bearish sentiment following a Q3 earnings miss and concerns over future sales and profitability. TSLA reported record deliveries, a robust $41.6B cash position, and strong free cash flow, supporting ambitious robotaxi and Optimus initiatives. Robotaxi and Full Self-Driving revenue are key growth drivers, with rapid scaling expected as soon as early 2026; energy storage also shows strong momentum.

title: TSLA Too Focused on Future? Hatem Dhiab Talks Tesla's Mixed Earnings
text: Hatem Dhiab was generally underwhelmed by Tesla's (TSLA) latest quarterly earnings. He makes the case that Tesla has too much emphasis on its autonomous vehicles and robotics, arguing that a bigger focus on something like a Model Y will offer a larger runway for short-term growth to support that future.

title: Analyzing TSLA Tech Potential: "Underwhelming" Earnings v. Autonomous "Big Risk"
text: Tesla (TSLA) reported yet another earnings miss Wednesday after the closing bell, though Andrew Graham believes its A.I. and robotics prospects overshadowed the earnings.

title: Nvidia is backing a former Tesla executive's bid to drive low-cost energy
text: Redwood Materials plans to meet the AI-fueled demand for energy with recycled electric-car batteries.

title: Tesla bull Dan Ives talks why he's still bullish, AT&T COO talks wireless competition
text: Market Catalysts anchor Julie Hyman breaks down the latest market trends for October 23, 2025. Tesla reported third quarter earnings results on Wednesday after the bell.

title: Canaccord Genuity's Gianarikas: Tesla results increased conviction, but cautiousness remains
text: George Gianarikas, managing director at Canaccord Genuity, joins CNBC's 'The Exchange' to discuss his reaction to Tesla's most recent quarter.

title: 3 Make-or-Break Items From Tesla to Note From Yesterday's Earnings Report
text: The expiration of a federal EV tax credit will likely hurt Tesla sales. The company's profit margins for automotive sales are falling.

title: Top Stock Movers Now: IBM, Tesla, Molina Healthcare, and More
text: Major U.S. equities indexes mostly advanced Thursday as investors monitored China trade developments and digested the latest batch of corporate earnings. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq were higher, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average was little changed.

title: Elon Musk's Robot Army Is Coming — If He Gets Total Control First
text: Elon Musk's third-quarter earnings call wasn't just about revenue growth — it was a declaration of intent. While Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) reported $28.1 billion in quarterly sales, up from $25.2 billion a year ago, the real story was Musk's blueprint for the future: AI, autonomous robots, and total control over the company's destiny.

title: Tesla will struggle to attract new customers to the brand, says Haig Partners' John Murphy
text: John Murphy, Haig Partners managing director, joins 'Money Movers' to discuss Tesla's quarterly earnings results, if Tesla's install base is the 'Trojan Horse' for its AI ambitions and much more.

title: Tesla Q3: The Storm Investors Don't See
text: Tesla, Inc. reported Q3 '25 revenue of ~$28B, beating estimates, but EPS missed and profitability declined sharply, raising concerns about business health. Q3 deliveries were boosted by expiring EV tax credits, likely pulling forward demand and setting up TSLA for weaker sales and margin pressure in future quarters. Regulatory credit revenue dropped 44% YOY, and new legislation eliminates penalties for non-compliance, removing a key profit stream for TSLA.

title: Tesla's Stock Is Sliding After Earnings. Next Up: A Big Vote on Elon Musk's Pay
text: Tesla's monthslong upward run has slowed. That has investors contemplating what's next for the stock with a vote on a huge new pay package for its chief just around the corner.

title: Tesla entering a 'golden chapter' with autonomous vehicles & robotics, Wedbush's Dan Ives says
text: Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk is working to position the EV maker as the dominant robotics player. At the upcoming meeting, Tesla shareholders will vote on Musk's pay package, valued at up to $1 trillion.

title: Tesla Q3 Earnings Miss Expectations, Revenues Increase Y/Y
text: TSLA's Q3 EPS misses estimates, but rising revenues, strong deliveries, and surging energy growth power solid momentum.

title: Analysts Mixed on TSLA Future A.I. & Robotics Prospects Following Earnings Miss
text: Tesla (TSLA) missed earnings for the fourth consecutive quarter despite posting record revenue. Marley Kayden takes investors through the gauntlet of analyst reactions to the latest report, which shows an unclear consensus on where they see Tesla's stock down the road.

title: Tesla Remains The Purest Expression Of The Market's Appetite For Optionality
text: Tesla, Inc.'s value today goes beyond its current earnings, reflecting the optionality embedded in its frontier technologies like AI-driven autonomy, energy storage, and humanoid robots. Strong TSLA Q3 results show growth across automotive, energy, and services divisions, with improving margins and operational discipline. AI-driven autonomy leverages TSLA's massive installed base, allowing software monetization and future Robotaxi potential without major incremental capex.

title: Tesla's Earnings Review: Does the Juice Justify the Squeeze?
text: Tesla Inc. NASDAQ: TSLA went into Wednesday's earnings report with sky-high expectations. The stock was primed for a big move either way after doubling in value since April and trading in a tight range between $425 and $445 in recent weeks.

title: Tesla Shares Stumble 5% After Third Quarter Profit Sinks
text: Tesla shareholders requested that executives discuss details about plans for new car models, updates on Tesla's robotaxi plans and how the automaker would fare after a tax credit for EVs expired earlier this month, but CEO Musk spent much of the earnings call discussing Tesla's humanoid robot, Optimus. Musk, who said Tesla had become the “leader in real-world AI,” suggested the company was “on the cusp of something really tremendous with Optimus,” which Musk said has the “potential to be the biggest product of all time.

title: Tesla had a good quarter, but analyst eyes EV firm's ' autonomous path'
text: Tesla Inc's (NASDAQ:TSLA) most recently reported three months represent "a good quarter while laying the autonomous path,” that's the view from West Coast-based stockbroker Wedbush. Analyst Dan Ives, a notable Tesla bull, highlighted continued revenue momentum and accelerating progress across its self-driving and energy segments.

title: Watch These Tesla Price Levels as Stock Skids After Earnings Miss
text: Tesla (TSLA) shares fell Thursday morning after the company's quarterly profit came in short of analysts' estimates, even as it returned to revenue growth following two quarters of declines.

title: Tesla profits fall, oil prices surge as US imposes sanctions on Russian oil
text: Morning Brief: Market Sunrise anchot Ramzan Karmali breaks down the latest market moves for October 23, 2025. Tesla reported third quarter earnings on Wednesday, with revenue rising above Wall Street expectations while quarterly earnings fell below estimates.

title: Tesla recalls over 63K Cybertrucks over parking light issue that could increase risk of crash
text: In a recall report, Tesla estimated that 100% of the 63,619 impacted vehicles have the defect.

title: This underrated Tesla business deserves more attention — and it's not AI
text: Many people think of Tesla Inc. as an carmaker, even as Chief Executive Elon Musk insists it's more of a “real-world AI” company. But for now, perhaps there's something else investors should view Tesla as: an energy company.

title: Tesla: Priced For Perfection
text: Tesla, Inc. delivered mixed Q3 results, with record revenue, double-digit top line growth, and surging free cash flow driven by expiring EV tax credits. However, the EV company missed on EPS. Tesla's gross margins improved sequentially to 18%, and free cash flows grew 3.8X faster than revenue. Despite robust Q3 performance, a drop in Q4 deliveries and revenue must be expected as consumers front-loaded purchases ahead of expiring tax credits.

title: Wall Street's Top Thursday Analyst Calls: Netflix, IBM, Tesla, and Microsoft
text: The image featured for this article is © 24/7 Wall St.

title: Tesla Stock Deserves To Fall Further
text: Tesla, Inc. posted record sales for Q3, driven by expiring tax credits, but earnings and margins fell short of justifying its current valuation. TSLA faces capped demand, declining production in key models, and limited growth prospects with no major new vehicles on the horizon. Energy storage is a bright spot, but even with strong growth and margins, it is not enough to move TSLA's overall valuation.

title: Elon Musk sees Tesla moving beyond being a car company into an AI company, says Walter Isaacson
text: Walter Isaacson, ‘Elon Musk' author and Perella Weinberg advisory partner, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed pay package, future of Tesla, Paramount's bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, and more.

title: Tesla stock sinks today after earnings miss. Elon Musk seems more focused on building a ‘robot army'
text: On Wednesday, October 22, Tesla released its third-quarter earnings with a side of begging from CEO Elon Musk.

title: Wall Street futures flat; Tesla drops, quantum stocks jump on Trump funding talks
text: 8:45am: Futures tread water US stock futures were treading water early Thursday as investors digested a mixed bag of corporate earnings, fresh sanctions on Russian oil, and a continued tug-of-war between growth hopes and macro worries. Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 were hovering near the flat line, while Nasdaq 100 contracts were also little changed following Wednesday's selloff.

title: Nasdaq 100 and S&P500: US Stocks Slip as Tesla, IBM Earnings Hit Market Forecasts
text: US stock market dips as Tesla, IBM earnings miss targets. Rising oil prices and trade tensions pressure tech stocks and weigh on Nasdaq 100 and S&P500 indices.

title: Tesla ($TSLA) Q3 Performance Marks a New Record for Vehicle Deliveries and Energy Storage Products
text: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) achieved strong operational results in this years third quarter, producing more than 447,000 vehicles and delivering over 497,000. This performance marks a new record for vehicle deliveries, underscoring continued demand for Tesla's lineup.

title: Tesla, IBM, Molina Healthcare And Other Big Stocks Moving Lower In Thursday's Pre-Market Session
text: U.S. stock futures were mixed this morning, with the Dow futures falling around 0.2% on Thursday.

title: Tesla's earnings miss, Meta job cuts, U.S. sanctions Russian oil and more in Morning Squawk
text: Tesla shares slid after its third quarter earnings came in below expectations. The White House placed more sanctions on Russia's largest crude oil companies.

title: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (Oct 23)
text: Tesla Inc.'s (NASDAQ: TSLA) share price is 2.4% higher than a week ago, despite volatility after it posted record sales undercut by rising costs, resulting in disappointing earnings.

title: Where Will Tesla Be in 5 Years?
text: If CEO Elon Musk ends up being right about the direction of the business, then Tesla's revenue and profits should grow significantly in the future. It is possible that Tesla will not achieve huge successes with its robotaxis or its humanoid robots.

title: Vendig: Investors see Tesla as a transformable tech company
text: Brian Vendig, CIO at MJP Wealth Advisors, says Tesla's high valuation reflects its tech potential, not profits. He supports Musk's pay plan for innovation but warns of competition from Waymo and profit risks.

title: What Lies Ahead for Mag-7 ETFs in Q3 Earnings Season?
text: Mag-7 earnings season heats up. Will AAPL, MSFT, NVDA, AMZN & META lift ETFs like MAGS, FNGS, MGK & XLG?

title: Tesla has really been suffering from a lull in their product pipeline, says CFRA's Garrett Nelson
text: Garrett Nelson, CFRA equity analyst, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss Tesla's company quarterly earnings results, fate of CEO Elon Musk's proposed pay package, company growth outlook, and more.

title: Tesla's ‘AI Transformation' Is in Focus for Analyst Dan Ives
text: Dan Ives, global head of tech research at Wedbush Securities, discusses the importance of autonomous driving to Tesla's future as he expects the company to achieve a $3 trillion market cap in the next 12-18 months and makes the case for Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package. -------- More on Bloomberg Television and Markets Like this video?

title: Tesla Stock Depends on Musk's Robot Army. Why Fierce Competition Is a Problem.
text: Tesla earnings disappoint, federal worker pay is on ice, Southwest says changes are working, and more news to start your day.

title: AMERICAS Oil jumps and Tesla skids
text: What matters in U.S. and global markets today

title: Focus: Tesla's big gamble that introducing new models no longer matters
text: Tesla's groundbreaking 2017 Model 3 electric sedan, followed by a taller Model Y variant, ushered in the era of mass-market electric cars, made Tesla the world's most valuable automaker and CEO Elon Musk the world's richest man.

title: Tesla Q3 earnings fall short
text: Tesla quarterly earnings disappoint due to elevated costs, sending shares down in extended trade. CEO Elon Musk has defended his $1tn pay packet.
